name: Cabernet Sauvignon Penedès Rosado
review: Packed with strawberry and currant jam flavors, along with watermelon candy and cream notes. Very expressive, featuring lively acidity throughout, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Brut Cava 1+1=3 Cygnus
review: Pretty spice and floral aromas lead to ripe and juicy black cherry, blood orange and sliced almond flavors in this well-balanced, vivacious Cava. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Cava 1+1=3
review: Ripe raspberry and smoke notes are set on the lively bead of this clean-cut rosé Cava. Spice and Meyer lemon zest accents linger on the juicy finish. Disgorged April 2017. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Penedès Rosado
review: Ripe strawberry, blackberry, violet and spice notes mix in this vinous rosé, backed by juicy acidity. Balanced and fresh. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brut Nature Cava 1+1=3 Cygnus Reserva
review: There's zesty drive to this open-knit Cava. The lively, creamy bead carries flavors of Asian pear, honey and ground ginger, with a smoky underpinning. A fine aperitif. Drink now. 1,080 cases made.

name: Xarel-lo Penedès
review: Expressive, maturing flavors of pear, almond and herb. Good body and crisp acidity.  Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Brut Cava
review: Light-weight and aromatic, with hints of berry, spice and clementine. Tangy acidity. Its refined texture recommends this as an aperitif. Drink now. 6,700 cases made.

name: Brut Cava 1+1=3
review: A clean-cut sparkler, with fresh acidity and modest notes of green pear, spring forest and almond skin. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Brut Cava 1+1=3
review: This open-knit, balanced Cava offers a lively bead and zesty acidity, buoying flavors of baked pear, toast, smoke and saline. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brut Nature Cava
review: Smells and tastes both mature and exotic, displaying mango and passion fruit aromas and flavors on a round yet dry frame. Really persistent flavors and harmony. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Penedès Rosado
review: A deeply colored rosé, with cassis and blackberry flavors and clean, integrated acidity. Try with light food. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Penedès Rosado
review: Candied flavors of cherry and raspberry are balanced by bright acidity and hints of spice and orange peel notes. This shows light tannins and would pair well with ham. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Penedès Dèfora
review: Generous, with ample structure, ripe, full tannins and round flavors of plum, cola and tobacco. Maturing now, but still fresh on the finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,130 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Penedès Rosado
review: Black cherry, herb and tar notes mingle in this assertive dry rosé. It has a deep color and evident tannins, but has just enough acidity for freshness. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Brut Cava
review: Creamy and verging on medium-bodied, offering light citrus and honey notes, with a hint of straw. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brut Cava
review: Quite crisp, with a light grain and flavors of apple, green pear, almond and candied lemon peel. Modest finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Penedès Doga
review: Assertive tannins dominate the light black cherry fruit, but it has depth, and a pretty floral note emerges on the finish. Try with food. Drink now through 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Brut Cava
review: Firm, with a frothy bead and a smoky undertow, this offers hints of macerated apricot, sea salt and anise. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Penedès Rosé
review: Herb and spice notes accent hints of tomato leaf and black currant in this basic rosado. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Penedès Rosado
review: This ponderous rosé shows black cherry and vegetal notes. Dry yet still a bit cloying. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Nicely polished, with pretty apricot, citrus and spice flavors that echo on the smooth finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Light and crisp, with modest black cherry fruit and hints of pepper as the finish fades. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Saturated with cherry, black currant and floral notes, this red evokes licorice, wild herb and stone accents. Solidly built yet refined, with a Burgundian quality common to many 2010 Riservas. Shows superb balance and extraordinary length. Best from 2018 through 2035. 800 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Asphalt and tar on the nose, with lots of dried dark fruits. Full and very powerful, with layers of chewy tannins and masses of fruit. Really needs time to mellow and come together. But it's all there. A blockbuster. Balanced and fabulous. Best after 2012. 500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Complex aromas of rose, blackberry, blueberry and dark chocolate. Full-bodied, with wonderfully velvety tannins and focused, juicy, rich fruit. Long and intense. The finish shows berry, tobacco, toasty oak, berry and chocolate. Goes on and on. One of the wines of the vintage. Best after 2011. 1,890 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Very pure, with alluring aromas and flavors of strawberry, currant and cherry surrounded by a supple texture. This suave red is firmly structured, with a lingering finish of spice and mineral. Already quite open, but complex and firmly structured. Best from 2015 through 2030. 420 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This is packed with sweet cherry, plum and mulberry fruit, accented by licorice, leather and spice notes. Shows grip and character, with a mouthwatering finish. Best from 2018 through 2033. 2,100 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Exudes a ferrous aroma and flavor, with cherry, currant, tobacco and spice flavors adding depth and interest. Taut and almost racy, with a long, sinewy finish. This will be interesting when it unfolds. Best from 2021 through 2035. 1,600 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This intense red is on the racy side, with vibrant acidity and entrenched tannins supporting the floral, cherry, licorice and spice aromas and flavors. Plays out gracefully on the palate, with a lingering finish. Best from 2014 through 2024. 1,660 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Starts out supple, with licorice, dried cherry and plum flavors, picking up a touch of herbs as this glides to a lingering conclusion. Elegant and almost racy, with grip and character. Best from 2013 through 2025. 1,600 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Aromas of blackberry, spices and dried mushrooms follow through to a full-bodied palate, with big velvety tannins and a long finish. This is powerful and layered. Big, juicy wine. Best after 2009. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Rich cherry, currant, cedar and spice flavors are accented by meaty sanguine notes. Guided by the firm frame, this is dense and structured, with beefy tannins on the finish. Built for the long haul. Best from 2014 through 2032. 400 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Menthol, cherry, strawberry and licorice flavors highlight this juicy red. Nicely framed by dusty tannins that emerge on the finish, this is balanced and long overall. Best from 2018 through 2028. 1,800 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: There's very pretty aromas of mulberry and flowers in this full-bodied red, with toasty oak, coffee and dark fruits on the palate and a chewy, tannic finish. Still tight and holding back. Best after 2012. 1,365 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Shows wonderful aromas of ripe berry, fresh mushroom, cigar box and spices. Full-bodied, with superfine tannins and a long finish. Excellent for the vintage. Best after 2010. 1,660 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Flavors of sweet cherry and berry fruit, leather, tobacco and eucalyptus are matched to a fresh, vibrant structure, with plenty of tannins for support. This stays balanced, with a long, resonant aftertaste. Best from 2017 through 2030. 416 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Begins with pretty cherry and floral notes before turning firm and dense, with dusty tannins. This will need some time for the sweet fruit, spice and leather flavors to meld. Offers a fine, minerally finish. Best from 2016 through 2030. 1,650 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Very attractive aromas of ripe raspberry, toasty oak and cedar follow through to a full-bodied palate, with well-integrated tannins and a long finish. Excellent for the vintage. I like this as much as the 1999. Very well done. Best after 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Impressive aromas of ripe fruit and fresh mushrooms, with hints of tobacco. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a generous berry, spice and tar aftertaste. I like this stylish red. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Lovely rose and berry on the nose. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a long caressing finish. Layered and refined. Best after 2009. 250 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: There's plenty of ripe black cherry and plum fruit here, offset by leather, earth, a resinous oak note and gripping tannins. Features vivid acidity, concentration and intensity. Built to age. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2015 through 2022. 660 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: Very ripe berry and sage aromas follow through to a full body, with fine, polished tannins and a good amount of vanilla and cappuccino character. Layered and polished. This great Brunello producer delivers an excellent super Tuscan. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2010. 800 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: Plum skin and light raisin aromas, with hints of licorice, follow through to a full-bodied palate. Silky tannins and a long finish. Firm and tight now. Give this time. Best after 2009. 450 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: A full-throttle red, with loads of ripe fruit and intense vanilla character. Full, velvety and powerful. Long finish. Best after 2007. 430 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Offers an attractive mix of floral, cherry, cedar and licorice aromas and flavors, backed by a spine of tannins and acidity. Still compact on the finish, but finds equilibrium in the end. Should come around nicely. Best from 2016 through 2028. 1,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: A decadent and rich red, with meat, berry and floral character. Full-bodied, with soft and round tannins and an opulent, meaty and ripe fruit aftertaste. Drink now. 270 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Dense, with beefy tannins backing the cherry, leather and earth flavors. The firm yet juicy finish shows tobacco and iron accents. Drink now through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Though firm, this is loaded with raspberry, cherry, leather and spice flavors. Vibrant and beautifully balanced, offering a lingering, juicy aftertaste of fresh fruit and tobacco. Drink now through 2020. 1,900 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A clean, fruity red, with strawberry, raspberry and a hint of creamy mineral. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh, fruity finish. Well-balanced and delicious. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Toscana Castellaccio Red
review: Lots of blackberry and cherry on the nose with hints of flowers. Full-bodied, spicy and rich with plenty of fruit and a meaty, lightly raisined character. Some may find it overdone but it's exciting. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best after 2007. 1,100 cases made.

name: Toscana Castellaccio Red
review: Big and rich with loads of spice, meat and berry character. Full-bodied, round and rich. As good as the 1999. Best after 2006. 1,660 cases made.

name: Toscana Castellaccio Red
review: Very peppery and fruity on the nose with full-bodied, spicy flavor, silky tannins and a long finish. Sangiovese, Cabernet and Syrah. Best after 2006. 1,100 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: An elegant version, laced with graphite, cherry, cedar and loam flavors. Turns lean and firm on the finish, with a chalky sensation emerging. Needs food. Best from 2015 through 2021. 666 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: There's lots of plum, spice and meat aromas and flavors, with just a hint of new oak. Round and rich, with a fruity, lightly chewy finish. Stylish. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2010. 420 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: Very ripe fruit aromas, with licorice and berry character. Full-bodied and very velvety, with soft texture and vanilla character. Should turn out very nicely indeed. Best Rapace ever. Best after 2005. 250 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Very typical in style, with ripe fruit, tobacco and meat aromas. Full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a velvety, fruity finish. Slightly over extracted, but impressive. Less overdone than the 1997. Best after 2004. 1,200 cases made.

name: Castellaccio Red
review: Impressive. Shows crushed blackberry and flower character a'plenty and is full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, long finish. Best after 1998. 650 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: This is smooth and polished after a few hours of aeration, boasting cherry, earth and spice flavors. Balanced and bright on the long finish. Drink now through 2019. 2,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Very serious rosso here. Medium-dark ruby. Subtle berry, green tobacco and raspberry aromas. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, fruity finish. Best after 2000. 1,550 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: This red shows power, with a lush texture and a coating of cherry and blackberry fruit flavors backed by a dense matrix of tannins. A bit compact, but fresh and long. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2019. 833 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: A tightly wound, compact red, with stiff tannins from both grapes and oak. At its center is a core of cherry, tobacco, spice and mineral notes. They will need time to relax and come forward. Fine length. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2014 through 2024. 666 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: Shows a lot of blueberry and dried herb aromas and flavors. Full and juicy, with plenty of good fruit. Still chewy. Best after 2011.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Rich and riddled with cherry and raspberry flavors, this lush Rosso balances furry tannins with a persistent, tobacco-tinged aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 1,916 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Cherry, currant and earth notes permeate this muscular Rosso. The structure provides a strong foundation. Balanced on the meaty side, with moderate length. Best from 2014 through 2019. 1,900 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Intense aromas of ultradry fruit, with sultana and prune character. Full-bodied and chewy, with a tobacco and raisin aftertaste. Rustic and slightly overdone, yet an impressive red. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Pretty plum, berry and floral aromas with hints of strawberries. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fruity, autumnal aftertaste. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Wonderful balance of ripe fruit and silky tannins. Full- to medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long aftertaste of ripe berry, cherry and earth. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Toscana Castellaccio Red
review: A smooth, enjoyable red. Plums with hints of cream on the nose. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a long, caressing finish. Drink now. 825 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: I like the blackberry, licorice and rosemary aromas here. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a flavorful finish. Nice wine. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2005. 300 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: Soft and well-balanced, with berry and light chocolate character and a hint of fresh herb. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a relaxed finish. A good drink. Best from 2004 through 2010. 440 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: Ripe and generous, with a decadent, earthy note. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a ripe finish. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: A harmonious red, with light chocolate and berry character, medium body and a fine, silky-textured finish. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2004. 330 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Loads of mahogany and ripe fruit character, with a funky edge. Full-bodied and silky, with a sweet fruit finish. Tart. Slightly old-style. Drink now. 230 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A fruity, plummy red, with a dense medium body, light tannins and a clean fruit and mineral finish. Very clean. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Decadent on the nose, with ripe fruit and bark. Medium-bodied, with ripe, round tannins and a long, fruity finish. Delicious Rosso. Drink now through 2003. 500 cases made.

name: Toscana Rapace
review: There is ample cherry and berry fruit in this red, but also dense, beefy tannins. Finishes on the dry side, but food will help. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Rather simple really, but clean and well done, with dried cherry and chocolate character. Medium to light in body and tannins. A light, fruity finish. Drink now. 442 cases made.

name: Chianti
review: Some raisin and pepper character follows through to a medium-bodied palate, with a simple finish. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A clean-cut Rosso, with plum, berry and light mineral character. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fresh, fruity finish. Drink now. 1,440 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Very aromatic, with dried cherries and flowers. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fresh finish. Drink now. 440 cases made.

name: Toscana Castellaccio Red
review: At its peak. Peppery, earthy and gamy. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a fruity, earthy finish. Drink now. 1,110 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Pleasant mineral, strawberry and vanilla up front. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins. Slightly hot finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A laid-back, silky red, with ripe red fruit aromas and flavors, medium body and a fruity finish. Slightly tart. Needs food. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Delicious rosso. Pretty dried cherries and violets on the nose. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fresh and fruity finish. Drink now. 442 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A medium-bodied red, with plum, berry and a hint of vanilla character. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Medium-bodied, with some berry and cedar character and a light finish. A little austere. Drink now. 640 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Pretty berry and tobacco character, but with earth and bothersome funk on the nose. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a tart finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Castellaccio White
review: A medium-bodied offering, with vanilla- and apple-accented almond and marzipan character. Moderate acidity. Drink now. 290 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: This is very tart, with lemon and berry character. Simple. This is disappointing, considering the excellent quality of the Brunello. Drink now.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Aromas of ripe berries and earth, with hints of cheese. A bit tired. Medium-bodied, with a light, slightly decadent finish. Very mature. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Slightly tired already, with smoke, cedar and berry aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, smooth in texture. Drink now. 108 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Of a slightly traditional nature, but this shows some interesting aromas and flavors of game, earth and berry. Light bodied, light finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Chianti
review: Short with peppery, cooked fruit character. Doesn't taste like Chianti. 2,200 cases made.

name: Toscana Castellaccio White
review: Hard to get excited about this white. Medium-bodied, with fruit cocktail flavors and a bubbly finish. 290 cases made.

name: Merlot Toscana Canto 1°
review: Plenty of roses and other flowers on the nose and palate. Full-bodied, with good tannins and acidity. Medium finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Merlot Toscana Petraia
review: Very pretty, with blackberry, rose and vanilla character. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins and a complex, fruity finish. Delicious. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Toscana Petraia
review: Blackberry and floral aromas, with hints of rose. Medium-bodied, with a slightly herbal undertone. A little loosely knit. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2009. 550 cases made.

name: Toscana Petraia
review: Rather jammy with strawberry and raspberry character. Full, round and one-dimensional. Merlot and a dash of Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Falconeri
review: Attractive berry and floral character, with medium body and a fresh finish. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Toscana Petraia
review: Round and fruity, with berry and strawberry character. Medium-bodied, with a clean finish. Lacks a bit of concentration. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Falconeri
review: Straightforward Cab, with currant and fresh earth character. Medium body, with good fruit. A little rustic, but good with pasta and meat sauce. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Falco de'Neri
review: A medium-bodied red, with bright berry, currant and fresh oak. Clean and well-balanced, with fresh fruit and vanilla on the finish. Best after 2008. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Falco de'Neri
review: Straightforward, with berry and slight raisin character. Medium- to full-bodied, with plenty of fruit and a slightly rustic finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Colli Fiorentini La Casa di Dante Alighieri
review: Interesting aromas and flavors of black cherry and Brazil nut. Medium-bodied, with a clean fruity finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Colli Fiorentini La Casa di Dante Alighieri
review: A medium-bodied red, with cherry and earth character on a silky palate. Fresh finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Riserva
review: Easygoing Chianti, with some red fruit and mineral character. Medium body. Clean finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Riserva
review: Very ripe, with a cooked fruit character. Full and round. But chewy and a little funky. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Colli Fiorentini La Casa di Dante Alighieri
review: Fresh Chianti, with bright berry and spicy chocolate aromas and flavors. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Riserva
review: A simple wine with cherry character. Medium body. Short finish. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Colli Fiorentini La Casa di Dante Riserva
review: Red berry and citrus character. Light and fresh. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Falco de'Neri
review: Light and stewed. Hard to like. 6,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Gallina
review: Ultraripe, dense and sweet-tasting, this fills the palate, melting like vanilla sauce, blending black fruit with spice and tar. Balanced and delicious. Just a slight herbal touch, but amazing quality for a '96 Barbera. 290 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Gallina
review: Smooth and supple, with spice, mocha and mushroom character, the oak accents bring out toasted bread, black pepper and blackberry notes. A pleasant, modern-style. Drink now through 2005. 140 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Gallina
review: Good acidity and fresh fruit aromas make for a lively, vibrant Barbaresco, medium-bodied and balanced, with blood orange, blackberry, cranberry and mineral flavors. A bit dry and short on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Gallina
review: Good, with fresh berry flavor, smacking acidity and a crisp finish. Not overly herbal, just a bit. Drink now. 380 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Gallina
review: This medium-bodied Barbaresco offers some modest fruit, dry tannins and a short, mouthpuckering finish. 255 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: A serious red, quite supple, rich and enjoyable, featuring lots of color, fruit flavor and significant tannins. Full-bodied and layered with accents of roasted meats, violets and blackberries. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch De Waal
review: Juicy, with lots of ripe red and black cherry and blackberry fruit flavors, sweet toast and nice cocoa and mineral hints. Long and lively on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 800 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: A bit light, but with good pear and fig notes, and some toast and hazelnut notes coming in on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Sweetish, with lime and floral notes. Open-knit finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Light and crisp, with good straw and citrus notes, and a bracing finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Red currant and cherry fruit is open-knit up-front, but firm tannins close in on the finish. A gamble to come into balance. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Lean and taut, with lime and chalk notes that fade a touch on the finish. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Modest pear and apple fruit up front, with a slightly earthy, matchstick note in the end. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Interesting aromas of butter and matchstick, but they fall a bit flat on the palate. Finish is a touch dilute, with an earthy streak as well. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Still has some prune and black cherry fruit left, but the tannins are winning now as this dries out. Tough finish. Past its prime. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch
review: Muddled, with wet forest and prune notes followed by a drying, astringent finish. Tough customer. Past its prime.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Short on fruit, with a funky, earthy edge. Dull and dilute on the finish. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch
review: Flaccid and cidery. Cooked. Past its prime. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Frux Frugis
review: Ripe, lively and focused. A plump mouthful of blueberry, plum, vanilla and spice flavors that persist impressively on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2015. 1,000 cases made.

name: Dona McLaren Vale
review: Cumin, caraway and tobacco notes complement the dense, velvety core of black cherry, blueberry juice and ripe plum flavors. The concentration and spice accents continue on the long, expressive finish. Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2030. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Dona
review: Complex and concentrated, with black tea, fresh loam and thyme accents to the dark, dense plum, cassis and black licorice flavors. Toothsome on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Frux Frugis
review: Opulent and flashy, with fleshy, ripe plum and blackberry flavors accented by plenty of spice and black pepper, bay leaf and savory accents. Robust finish. Drink now through 2028. 500 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Frux Frugis
review: Big, warm and velvety, with layers of deep, dark black cherry, plum and spice flavors, hinting at green olive around the edges. Has depth and length, and it should only deepen with time in the cellar. Drink now through 2015. 800 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Familia
review: Supple and generous, with seamless flavors of raspberry coulis and black cherry, accented by clove, cinnamon and white pepper details that linger effortlessly, complemented by black tea hints. Drink now through 2026. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sparkling Shiraz McLaren Vale Flamma
review: A dark, smoke- and expresso-scented version, with tangy black currant flavors. Creamy, spicy and rich on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Familia
review: Lively berry and plum flavors are brightened by aromatic touches of orange zest and dried lavender, with firm, rustic tannins. Drink now through 2027. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Prospera
review: Juicy, offering tangy blackberry and black cherry flavors at the core, with fresh sage and black pepper accents, tannins firming on the finish, where a black walnut note comes in. Drink now through 2027. 750 cases made.

name: Dona Blanc McLaren Vale
review: The mix of lemon, green apple and mineral notes is light and refreshing, with plenty of fresh green herbal notes kicking in on the long finish. Marsanne, Viognier and Pinot Gris. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Dona
review: There's a savory note to the plum and berry flavors, with dense, muscular tannins. Mineral and fresh earth notes on the firm finish. Drink now through 2028. 3,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Blancs Sonoma Coast Heintz Vineyard
review: Distinctive, if unusual, with a crisp and lively texture and accents of lemon, mineral and cider. Drink now.

name: Rosé Hawaii Lokela
review: Soft and easy to sip, with modest notes of strawberry and tropical fruit. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Marche Pelago
review: This is medium- to full-bodied and elegant, with supple tannins framing ripe black currant and mulberry fruit and savory notes of smoky mineral, green olive and cured tobacco that linger on the refined finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Montepulciano and Merlot. Drink now through 2025. 1,000 cases made.

name: Marche Pelago
review: A balanced, savory red, with chalky tannins and flavors of cassis and black cherry fruit, layered with hints of forest floor, underbrush, spice box, leather and smoke. Elegant and well-knit, showing fruit and spice details on the chewy, lingering finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Montepulciano and Merlot. Best from 2018 through 2023. 1,800 cases made.

name: Castelli di Jesi Verdicchio Riserva Classico Plenio
review: Well-spiced and creamy, this sleek white is fresh and focused, offering flavors of crushed Asian pear, sliced almond, lemon meringue and dried apricot. Aromatic finish. Drink now through 2021. 2,000 cases made.

name: Castelli di Jesi Verdicchio Riserva Classico Plenio
review: A finely knit white, creamy and vibrant, offering a streak of salinity that underscores the palate of ripe Gala apple, creamed almond, chamomile, lemon preserves and dried apricot flavors, ending with a spiced finish. Drink now through 2022. 2,000 cases made.

name: Conero Campo San Giorgio Riserva
review: This harmonious red emphasizes elegance over power, deftly weaving fine tannins and fresh acidity with subtle layers of pureed black cherry, mineral and spice box, accented by bright hints of pomegranate and citrus peel. Drink now through 2021. 250 cases made.

name: Conero Cúmaro Riserva
review: A harmonious red, with good focus to the flavors of ripe damson plum, violet, star anise and graphite, set in an elegant, medium-bodied frame. Supple tannins and a lasting note of spice box hold sway on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 3,500 cases made.

name: Marche Pelago
review: Fresh and harmonious, offering sculpted tannins and a subtle, herbal overtone to the flavors of black currant, graphite, grilled herb, mocha and tar-tinged smoke. Not a powerhouse, but a well-knit version, with fine length. Cabernet Sauvignon, Montepulciano and Merlot. Drink now through 2025. 1,800 cases made.

name: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore Casal di Serra Vecchie Vigne
review: A vibrant, well-knit version, featuring chamomile and saline accents to the flavors of baked peach, lemon curd and almond skin. Silky, with a persistent finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,600 cases made.

name: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore Casal di Serra Vecchie Vigne
review: Light-bodied and lively, this is a textbook Verdicchio, offering fresh-cut apple, lemon curd and hay notes, with hints of flint and saline that echo on the lightly creamy finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,300 cases made.

name: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore Vecchie Vigne
review: Subtle apple and light orange character on the nose leads to a full body, with loads of fruit and an oily yet fresh finish. This is powerful, with lots of character from these old vines. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Conero Campo San Giorgio Riserva
review: Tangy and well-balanced, with aromatic hints of baking spices and leather underscoring the crushed cherry and damson plum fruit, accented by herb-marinated olive and smoky mineral notes. Presents a firm finish of moderate length. Drink now through 2020. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 250 cases made.

name: Conero Cúmaro Riserva
review: A pure beam of black cherry is laced with hints of cocoa powder, sandalwood and graphite notes in this finely balanced, medium-bodied red. Supple tannins firm the lingering, spiced finish. Drink now through 2021. 3,500 cases made.

name: Conero Cúmaro Riserva
review: An attractive, rustic red, delivering aromatic sun-dried plum and cherry notes, with full tannins and a finish of game, licorice and ash. Needs food to tame the tannins. Best from 2014 through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: Conero Cúmaro Riserva
review: A dark minerally streak runs through the rich cassis and plum sauce flavors, remaining fresh, with enough acidity to carry the notes of tar, charred rosemary and tobacco. Drink now through 2018.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Costamorro
review: Black plum and boysenberry notes are concentrated, with layers of spice and toasty oak, as cocoa, tar and grippy tannins drive the fine finish. A good pizza wine. Drink now. 1,750 cases made.

name: Rosso Conero Cúmaro
review: This rich red shows good depth to the roasted plum skin and black currant notes layered with espresso, licorice and grilled herb accents. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Plenio Riserva
review: Bright acidity guides this balanced, light- to medium-bodied white, which offers a creamy mix of yellow plum and Gala apple fruit, notes of candied lemon zest and accents of chalk and spice. Drink now through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore Casal di Serra Vecchie Vigne
review: An open-knit white backed by fresh acidity, this shows a subtle mix of crunchy white peach, preserved lemon and paraffin flavors, with hints of pickled ginger and fresh tarragon. Stony finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,300 cases made.

name: Conero Cúmaro Riserva
review: Lightly aromatic, with hints of dried marjoram and spice box, this medium-bodied red is balanced and structured by dusty tannins and shows a subtle palate of dried currant, olive tapenade and smoke. Enjoy with salumi. Drink now through 2021. 3,500 cases made.

name: Lacrima di Morro d'Alba Fonte del Re
review: Dark color, with incredibly perfumed aromas, more like roses and lilacs. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and a long finish. Unique wine. Best after 2003.

name: Marche Pelago
review: Well-balanced and accessible, this offers pretty black cherry and cassis fruit, with flavors of licorice snap, mocha and ground spice. The light tannins and fresh acidity push through on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Montepulciano and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 1,800 cases made.

name: Marche Pelago
review: Lots of plum and crushed strawberry aromas in this modern wine. Medium- to full-bodied, with soft and silky tannins and a long, berry, chocolate finish. Fruit-forward red. Drink now. 2,300 cases made.

name: Marche White Le Busche
review: Big white. Gold color with an orange tint. Very ripe fruit on the nose and palate, with oily, waxy character. Full body. Thick and overripe, but interesting. Try with smoked fish. Verdicchio and Chardonnay. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Marche White Le Busche
review: Full-blown style. Loads of character, with lots of apple, cream and toasted oak. Full-bodied, with apple, vanilla and cream flavors. Long, long finish. Verdicchio and Chardonnay. Drink now through 2004. 1,700 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Jorio
review: An elegant version, with a well-meshed core of ground spice, black cherry, espresso and licorice drop flavors, framed by fine-grained, supple tannins. Offers a fresh, focused finish. Drink now through 2020. 8,000 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Jorio
review: Racy, featuring dark plum and crushed cherry fruit flavors woven with hints of sage, tobacco and bittersweet chocolate. Fine tannins frame the solid finish. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Pecorino Terre di Chieti Vellodoro
review: Light-bodied and tangy, with a hint of fresh herb lacing the snappy Honeycrisp apple, slivered almond and stone flavors. Light- to medium-bodied and refreshing. Drink now through 2019. 12,000 cases made.

name: Rosso Conero Cúmaro
review: A burly, youthful red that Zin or Rhône lovers will enjoy. Inky in color, with a blast of spice, earth and wild berry. Full-bodied and velvety, with loads of fruit and funk on the finish. Best after 2000.

name: Rosso Conero Cúmaro
review: A deep color, concentrated fruit flavors and firm tannins make this a seriously enjoyable wine that may improve with cellaring. Has both depth of flavor and a lingering finish. Drink now through 2001. 1,000 cases made.

name: Rosso Conero San Lorenzo
review: Hints of leather and tobacco underscore the prominent flavors of crushed raspberry and black currant fruit in this medium-bodied red, with light, sculpted tannins defining the spiced finish. Drink now through 2019. 6,000 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Burgenland
review: Quite smoky with lovely flavors of ripe peach, pear and lemon drop. Well-structured, with a nice raciness and loads of spicy notes on the long, honeyed finish. Chardonnay. Drink now through 2020. 10 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Joiser Kirschgarten
review: Suave and sophisticated, with loads of luscious dark plum, blackberry, chocolate and cream flavors. Plush tannins are backed up by a firm, balanced structure. Espresso notes enliven the finish. Serious juice. Tempting now. Best from 2007 through 2011. 250 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Joiser Kirschgarten
review: Rich, ripe aromas and flavors of blackberry, kirsch and dark cherry provide a very modern appeal. Filled with plenty of loam, meat and spice, this shows impressive structure and concentration, with a finish of dark chocolate and smoke. Drink now through 2012. 665 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Ried Hallebühl
review: Luscious and spicy, with brooding dark plum, raspberry and baker's chocolate flavors. Full-bodied and tannic, with plenty of espresso notes on the finish. Hard to resist. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch, and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2012. 750 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Ried Hallebühl
review: Serious stuff. Dark and brooding, this is packed with violet, blackberry and smoke notes on a dense, almost chewy structure. It's really delicious now, but young and still marked by new oak. Long, lingering finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2007.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Ried Hallebühl
review: Dark and brooding, displaying blackberry, plum and mineral flavors backed by a full-bodied frame and muscular, oak-tinged structure. Still young, this is balanced and concentrated, with a long, licorice aftertaste. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2008.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Frauenkirchner Ried Hallebühl
review: Deeply colored, this is ambitious and unevolved, offering freshly crushed blackberries, milk chocolate and vanilla on a lush, ripe framework. Enough definition and tannins to keep it lively, yet it's enjoyable now. Drink now through 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Vom Stein
review: Stunning aromas of cherry and spices, followed by rich, cherry and cassis notes accented by earth and mineral. Still tightly wound at this point, with a very long finish of sweet fruit and minerals. Drink now through 2004. 25 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Beerenauslese Burgenland
review: Pure and intense, with loads of ripe peach, pear and apple flavors, backed up by firm acidity. Smoke and spice on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2015. 335 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Unter den Terrassen zu Jois
review: Lush and vibrant, with silky tannins and a mouthful of sweet cherry, spice and roast beef flavors. Stylish, with a rich finish of cream and hints of mocha. Drink now through 2011. 465 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Ried Hallebühl
review: Firm and structured, with some finesse as well. Reminiscent of Nebbiolo with a band of fresh berry, cherry and plum flavors, which linger nicely on  the spice-filled finish. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Ried Hallebühl
review: Dense and tightly wound, this exudes milk chocolate and wild berry and spice notes that need time to integrate with the ripe tannins. There's fine length with a lingering aftertaste of spice. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2004 through 2008. 10 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Burgenland
review: A luscious red, with long, rich, concentrated flavors of plum pudding, dark cherry and dark chocolate. The spicy finish is filled with mocha and cocoa notes. Drink now through 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Reserve
review: Combines finesse and power. Dense and rippling with blackberry, boysneberry and spice aromas and flavors on a bright, firm strucutre. Great balance and harmony, with a long finish. Drink now through 2008.

name: Beerenauslese Burgenland
review: Mouthcoating and spicy, this moderately sweet dessert white also displays grapefruit and floral notes backed by lively acidity. Very pure, with a spicy finish. Scheurebe. Drink now through 2008.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Joiser Kirschgarten
review: A dense, muscular style, with concentrated dark chocolate, white pepper and dark plum flavors. Has a tannic finish, with plenty of smoke and spice. Needs time in the cellar. Best from 2010 through 2013. 217 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Unter den Terrassen zu Jois
review: A ripe style, showing dense, concentrated flavors of dark plum and red cherry, with plenty of smoke notes. Raspberry notes fill the plush finish. Drink now through 2012. 633 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Unter den Terrassen zu Jois
review: Very focused, with dried cherry, dark plum and ganache flavors that are accented by plenty of savory and sweet spicy notes. The firm, minerally finish displays muscular tannins. Drink now through 2010. 625 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Frauenkirchner Haideboden
review: Smooth and medium-bodied, sporting a chocolate accent to the cherry flavor. Balanced and rich, in a modern style. The chocolate note echoes on the finish. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Vom Stein
review: Deeply colored, with intense blackberry, bittersweet chocolate, dark plum and dark cherry flavors. The long finish is filled with espresso, licorice and smoke. Drink now through 2010. 291 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Vom Stein
review: A soft, easygoing red, with concentrated flavors of blackberry jam and spice. It ends with a sandalwood note on the lively finish. Drink now through 2010. 415 cases made.

name: Scheurebe Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: A distinctive grassy, herbal note combines with lemon in this racy, almost tart TBA. Compact and tightly wound, it's medium-sweet, with a lingering aftertaste. Best from 2000 through 2005. 100 cases made.

name: Trockenbeerenauslese Neusiedlersee
review: An elegant, sweet white with a bracing edge thanks to brisk acidity, which carries the candied citrus and caramel flavors from the start through the long finish. Chardonnay, Pinot Gris, Welschriesling, Traminer and Sauvignon Blanc. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2006.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Delicious blackberry and cassis flavors show grace and density in this young light- to medium-bodied red. It's balanced, but a charmer, for early enjoyment. Drink now through 2004.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Dark and impenetrable. Aromas hint at violets, black cherry and iron, with flavors of boysenberry and cassis in this backward red. There's an elegance to it, despite being closed. Best from 2002 through 2005. 200 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Reserve
review: A modern, deeply colored version, with deft balance between the black cherry flavors and the corset of tannins. Elegant overall, it packs a lot of flavor, ending on a sweet fruit note. Drink now through 2001. 415 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Medium-bodied, with red currant and boysenberry flavors. Mineral and spice notes show on the crunchy and fresh-tasting finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Gelber-Roter Traminer Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: An aromatic style, very peachy-tasting, with some smoky notes. The plush finish features ripe melon and spice notes. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Gelber-Roter Traminer Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A rich white, viscous in texture yet fresh, with floral, peach, and citrus notes. It has immediate appeal, with a cleansing finish. Ideal summer aperitif. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Unter den Terrassen zu Jois
review: This supple Pinot features lots of ripe cherry and spice notes. Cola and rich berry notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 24 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Ried Hallebühl
review: Inky, rich and dark-colored, with concentrated cassis, plum and ripe cherry flavors. Impressive for its intensity, with cocoa and smoke on the firm, clean finish. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2008. 500 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Frauenkirchner Vom Stein
review: This serious red displays leather and animal aromas and flavors in addition to black currant and blackberry. Full-bodied and solidly structured, it benefits from new oak, adding a vanilla element on the finish. Drink now through 2001. 500 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Reserve
review: Lively, giving an impression of elegance, with a silky texture and blackberry and black currant notes all allied to a firm structure. A hint of bitterness on the finish. Drink now through 2004.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Reserve
review: Oozing with blackberries and ink, here's a suave, concentrated red whose freshly crushed raspberry and blackberry flavors hold court to the lingering finish. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Focused and fresh, with delicious smoked cherry and berry flavors and enough heft to give it body and style. A great barbecue wine. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Distinctive, with a barbecue sauce aroma, and dark plum and currant flavors. Mineral and wild herbal components extend on the finish. Drink now. 665 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Unter den Terrassen zu Jois
review: Sweet red cherry and spicy oak notes mingle in this supple, medium-bodied red. Firm tannins and a smoky accent emerge on the finish. Fine now with food, but will soften with age. Drink now through 2007.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Joiser Jungen Berg
review: Concentrated flavors of cherry candy and vanilla ride the smooth texture in this bright, focused Pinot Noir. It's well-balanced, with a lingering aftertaste. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2005.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Junger Berg
review: Good concentration, a succulent texture and a solid structure add up to an appealing, cherry- and vanilla-flavored red. Lingering finish, too. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Haideboden
review: A ripe, medium-bodied red, with dark plum and dark currant flavors, which feature meaty notes on the finish. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 30 cases imported.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Halbtrocken Neusiedlersee Urgesteins Hackelsberg
review: Delicate. Aromas of flowers and limes are followed by apple and mineral flavors. Balanced, appealing presentation. Tangy finish. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A vein of savory herb runs through the dried berry flavors, as meaty notes mark the finish. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Ripe and round, offering black cherry, blackberry and spice aromas and flavors on a soft structure, with enough grip to keep it interesting. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Needs air to alleviate the stinky note, but there's plenty of fresh, supple black currant and cherry underneath. Light on its feet, with a lingering finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2004.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: There are touches of ripeness to the baked apple and savory herbal flavors in this white, which delivers lemon meringue on the finish.  Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: A solid, medium-bodied Austrian red laced with blackberry flavors and a hint of bittersweet chocolate. Well-integrated, with ripe tannins and a lingering finish. Drink now through 2001. 6,250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Unter den Terrassen zu Jois
review: Chewy and flavorful, with pretty raspberry, smoke and spice notes. Balanced and structured, with a lingering finish of chocolate-covered cherries. Drink now through 2007. 665 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Neusiedlersee Urgesteins Hackelsberg
review: A soft, gentle white that shows flavors of peach, talc and sweet corn. Has a medium body, good concentration and finishes on an almond note. Drink now through 2000. 165 cases made.

name: Sankt Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Red currant and plum flavors are accented by notes of dried meat in this smoky red. Firm, savory finish. Drink now. 125 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Offers bright, juicy flavors of red plum, raspberry and red currant, with a firm finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Red plum and berry flavors are fresh and fruity in this medium-bodied red, with touches of mushroom and earth on the finish. Drink now. 9,166 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Spicy, with plenty of cinnamon and nutmeg flavors laid on top of cherry and plum fruit. The finish is crisp. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Gelber-Roter Traminer Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Spicy, with clove and cinnamon flavors predominating. Peach notes linger on the short, soft finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Gelber-Roter Traminer Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Distinctive. Fresh and lively, with floral, spice and apricot notes balanced by a juicy texture. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Unter den Terrassen zu Jois
review: Lots of forest floor and mushroom notes to this earthy red. Smoky finish.  Drink now. 10 cases imported.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Haideboden
review: Syrah-like, with meaty, smoky aromas and flavors of beef jerky and dark plum. Sinewy finish, with plenty of leather notes. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2008.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Vom Stein
review: Crisp, with red plum and cranberry flavors, with spice and orange peel notes on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Neusiedlersee
review: A curranty edge runs through this rich, supple red, augmenting the black cherry flavor. Quite full-bodied, with a lingering finish. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Gelber-Roter Traminer Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Rich and round, offering floral and apricot with accents of vanilla and butter. Very appealing, if a bit lacking in zip. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Gelber-Roter Traminer Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Delicate aromas and flavors of rose and litchi make this an attractive, easy-drinking white. Balanced on the soft side, with a hint of citrus peel on the finish. Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Neusiedlersee Junger Berg
review: Smooth texture, yet the flavors are firm and compact, remaining like currant throughout, with a hint of chocolate. Drink now. 530 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Ried Hallebühl
review: Rich and smooth, exhibiting mint and eucalyptus accents to the cherry flavor. Moderate tannins and smoky, spicy oak notes emerge on the finish. Zweigelt, Blaufränkisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2006.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Black cherry is the main flavor theme, with a hint of earth in this smooth, balanced red. Modest finish. Drink now.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: A supple style, with a cherry note framed by lively acidity and light tannins. A touch astringent on the finish. Drink now.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Fresh and fruity, in a Beaujolais style that's soft and easygoing, with flavors of black cherry and plum. Finishes with mouthwatering acidity. Drink now. 4,580 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Junger Berg
review: Slightly gamy aromas lead to plum and licorice flavors, while the texture is chewy. Appealing; just lacks a little follow-through. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Red Ried Hallebühl
review: Pretty use of new, toasted oak which marries well with the fruit, but it's a bit too light and lacks the ripeness to merit more attention. A blend of Zweigelt, Blaufrankisch and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland Frauenkirchner Vom Stein
review: Brambly, with a slightly lifted aroma and modest plum and berry flavors. Tastes of varnish on the finish.  20 cases imported.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Burgenland
review: Leathery aroma, with restrained plum and cassis flavor, which fall off quickly on the cola-infused finish. 8,335 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Blauburgunder
review: New oak adds butterscotch character, but there's not enough fruit flavor to match and the finish is tough.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Reserve
review: A bit on the edge, with some trapped carbon dioxide adding a prickle, but it also shows black cherry and plum backed by firm tannins. Difficult to judge today. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Zweigelt Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee
review: Light, thin and rather weedy, with some fruit character and a light structure.

name: Saint Laurent Qualitätswein Trocken Neusiedlersee Frauenkirchner Vom Stein
review: In a full-blown, exaggerated style with some hints of barnyard flavor and a resinous, woody element. More vegetal than fruity in character.

name: Lambrusco di Sorbara Vigna del Cristo
review: Strawberry tart, grated ginger, smoky mineral and ground anise notes ride the fine, creamy bead in this mouthwatering, rosé-colored Lambrusco. Well-knit and vivacious, with a bright, citrusy finish. Drink now through 2021. 600 cases imported.

name: Lambrusco Emilia Dolce
review: This well-balanced red features lovely layers of juicy ripe black cherry and black currant fruit, with balsamic, fragrant herb and graphite accents. Subtle, smoke-tinged finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Col Sassoso
review: Hints of spice box, melted licorice and tarry smoke underscore the boysenberry coulis and black currant flavors in this lively, balanced Lambrusco. Offers a savory finish, with touch of cured tobacco. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Col Sassoso
review: A smoky base note mixes with hints of candied black currant, licorice string, mulling spices and plum. This subtle version is creamy and balanced. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Lambrusco di Sorbara Vigna del Cristo
review: Baked strawberry and raspberry fruit is layered with tangy acidity in this dry and creamy Lambrusco. Light garnet in hue, with accents of singed orange peel and dried herb. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Col Sassoso
review: Very dry and tangy, featuring a chalky texture, this delivers a floral overtone to the flavors of black cherry, currant and red licorice. Balanced. Drink now. 750 cases imported.

name: Lambrusco Grasparossa di Castelvetro Robanera
review: Lightly sweet and fruit-forward, just balanced by juicy acidity and offering flavors of strawberry preserves, spiced plum, vanilla and raspberry. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Dolce Lambrusco dell'Emilia
review: A bright and tangy Lambrusco, balanced and easy-drinking, with wild berry and cherry fruit, accented by notes of underbrush and smoke. Spiced finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Dolce Rosé Vino Spumante
review: Soft in texture and juicy, this sweet sparkler delivers strawberry tart, plum cake and ground spice notes that leap from the glass. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Extra Dry Prosecco
review: Bright and balanced, this is a textbook Prosecco, with a lively bead carrying the flavors of white peach, sliced almond and candied lemon zest. Floral. Drink now. 1,223 cases imported.

name: Demi-Sec Vino Spumante
review: Sweet and frothy, this sparkler is balanced by citrusy acidity, offering flavors of biscotti, candied ginger, glazed nectarine and lemon curd. Drink now. 3,107 cases imported.

name: Lambrusco di Sorbara Vigna del Cristo
review: A lighter shade of Lambrusco, this ruby-colored version is fresh and bouncy, offering tangy flavors of white raspberry, wild strawberry, spice and smoke. Drink now. 750 cases imported.

name: Lambrusco di Sorbara Vigna del Cristo
review: Light-bodied and grapey, with a pronounced tang of acidity and hints of strawberry, white raspberry and spice. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Sangiovese Rubicone
review: Complex aromas of plums, licorice and smoked oak. Full-bodied, with big, soft tannins and a long, long, smoky, meaty aftertaste. Drink now. 1,125 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon Rubicone Liano
review: Hints of oak spice and mocha are layered with light, supple tannins and flavors of plumped cherry and fig cake in this well-knit, medium-bodied red. Elegant, with herb and smoke accents on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2022. 62,500 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon Rubicone Liano
review: A stylish red, with polished tannins and mocha and spice overtones, this is well-integrated, offering juicy acidity and flavors of crème de cassis, grilled plum, dried marjoram and smoky mineral. Drink now through 2019. 58,333 cases made.

name: Albana di Romagna Passito Colle del Re
review: Deep gold color, with almond and dried peach aromas and flavors. Full-bodied and medium-sweet, with some light spice and dried citrus fruits coming through on the finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Romagna Riserva
review: Exotic touches of coconut and incense lace this chewy, medium-bodied red, accenting the flavors of mulberry, mocha and smoke. Creamy finish. Drink now through 2020. 41,660 cases made.

name: Albana di Romagna Passito Colle del Re
review: Lots of late-harvest character, with aromas of burnt almond, spice and dried fig and apricot. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with a fruit finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Rubicone White Moma
review: A  bright, lip-smacking version, with a zesty accent to the up-front flavors of kiwifruit, green melon and star fruit. Trebbiano and Chardonnay. Drink now. 16,666 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Plum pudding, graphite and ground spice notes mix with a hint of kirsch in this lightly chewy red. Balanced and creamy on the palate. Drink now through 2017. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Framed by light tannins and tangy acidity, this features hints of leather and smoke, with creamy black currant and black cherry fruit and subtle notes of chocolate ganache and spice. Drink now through 2016. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Rubicone Tauleto
review: Sweet and smoky, with hints of grilled plum, spiced black cherry, fragrant leather and bresaola, this aging red holds on, offering modest tannins and a light juiciness throughout. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Rubicone Tauleto
review: Creamy, with moderate, vanilla-laced flavors of black cherry coulis, date, balsamico and dried black currant. A thread of sweet wood smoke leads to polished tannins. Modest finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon Rubicone Liano
review: Pleasant, almost jammy blackberry and light toasty character. Medium-bodied and well-balanced, with medium tannins, lots of fruit and a fresh finish. Best after 2006. 7,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Emilia Laurento
review: Rather unusual. Interesting aromas of pineapple skin, white pepper and vanilla. Medium-bodied, with coconut, toasted oak and apple flavors. Medium acidity. Drink now.

name: Emilia Liano
review: Good ruby color, with lovely perfumes of flowers and blackberry. Medium-bodied, with velvety tannins and a good shot of new wood on the finish. A bit too much new oak, but delicious. A blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon Rubicone Liano
review: Tangy and balanced, with hints of dried cherry and black currant, creamy licorice and spice. Light tannins show on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon Rubicone Liano
review: Subtle smoke and tar notes underscore currant, dried cherry, spice and graphite flavors in this modest red. A hint of coffee liqueur shows on the aromatic, lightly tannic finish. Drink now. 52,900 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon Rubicone Liano
review: Some berry and toasted oak character that turns to leather. Medium- to full-bodied, with chewy tannins and a medium finish. Bit rustic. Drink now. 7,080 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon Rubicone Liano
review: Not a big and powerful wine, but pretty and delicate, with chocolate and berry character, medium body and a subtle finish. Delicious. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Liano
review: A rustic-style red with plum, prune and game flavors. Hearty and full-bodied, though still a bit tannic. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 1998. 2,500 cases made.

name: Rubicone Polvere di Stelle
review: Rather simple with some cherry, lightly grassy character and hints of new wood. Nice enough. Original label with crystal studs--like a Graceland bottling. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Rubicone Tauleto
review: Loads of up-front oaky character gives off dried herbs and spices--rosemary, cardamom, cloves. Full-bodied, with good fruit and lots of new wood but finishes slightly short and diluted. Best after 2006. 1,150 cases made.

name: Albana di Romagna Passito Colle del Re
review: A full-bodied, sweet and smoky-tasting dessert wine with an amber color and a strong but simple flavor profile. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Some good, meaty black fruit and tobacco on the nose. Medium-bodied, with a slightly hollow palate. A touch austere on the finish. A bit four-square and woody. Best after 2006. 13,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Firm and moderately tannic, with an nice core of cherry flavors. Simple, but solid. Drink now. 80,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Modest, with a veneer of oak over the sweet, syrupy red and black fruit notes. Offers a light, smoky finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Simple and fruity, with plum and dark chocolate. Medium-bodied, with a light finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Rubicone Tauleto
review: Clean, fruity and fresh, with a medium to light body and a crisp finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Albana di Romagna Il Poggio
review: Quite dry and restrained, this is a solid, if simple, white wine with crisp acidity and fairly neutral fruit flavors. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Pignoletto-Chardonnay Emilia Malise
review: Fresh and crisp, with fresh lemon and dry stone character. Clean and light. Tart, even off-dry. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Rubicone Polvere di Stelle
review: Shows some berry character, but this is a little jammy and funky. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: A bit light with some decent berry and tobacco character. Drink now. 1,125 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Good color, with berry and chocolate and a slightly volatile nose. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a crisp finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: A solid table-wine, with straightforward plum and spice flavors and moderate tannins. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Rubicone Tauleto
review: An attractive red, with berry and pepper character. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fruity finish. Drink now. 965 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Lots of wood, but there's decent forest fruits and chocolate character. Rather thin and austere in the end. Drink now. 13,300 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Superiore Ca' Grande
review: Already mature with roasted, herbal flavors. Very soft and easy-drinking, though one-dimensional. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Superiore Il Poggio
review: Simple and satisfying, this offers some modest cherry and plum flavors, with good texture. Drink now.

name: Albana di Romagna Colle del Re
review: Candied pineapple, turning a little sharp on the palate. Simple. 4,170 cases made.

name: Albana di Romagna Colle del Re
review: Light, with tangy apple, mint and resin character. Dry finish. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 4,200 cases made.

name: Rubicone Moma
review: Starts with juicy black currant character, but turns slightly sour. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Laurento Riserva
review: Some strawberry jam but short and thin. 1,700 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Slightly green tasting, with plum flavors and assertive tannins. Fairly well balanced, but gets a little tough on the finish. 15,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese di Romagna Riserva
review: Funky and weedy, with some decent prune character. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Emilia Laurento
review: Clean, but overripe and dull. 800 cases made.

name: Albana di Romagna Colle del Re
review: Some almond and apple character, but it's slightly oxidized. 5,000 cases made.

name: Albana di Romagna Colle del Re
review: There's plenty of zip but not much fruit in this basic white. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Emilia Laurento
review: Tired-tasting, with an overwhelming flavor of turned apple cider. Not recommended. 2,000 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti
review: Light-bodied and fresh, mixing floral, nut, ripe pear and orange sorbet flavors. Lemony acidity and licorice spices lead to the subtle finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Vigneti di Ratti Mentone
review: Very green and herbaceous, with little ripe fruit, sweet tannins.

name: Titan Stellenbosch
review: Lovely boysenberry and blackberry fruit, augmented by alluring vanilla, toast, spearmint and chocolate notes. Long, supple finish lets the flavors linger. Concentrated but elegant. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2005. 7,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Stellenbosch
review: Alluring mint and cocoa aromas and flavors are layered with additional plum, fig and blackberry fruit. Plush, smoky finish let's the minty note take over. For fans of the style. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Stellenbosch
review: Wild wine, with mint, plum pudding, spice cake and fig aromas and flavors, with a lush, ripe texture, and a rich, chocolaty finish. Not quite dense enough for outstanding, but a nicely authentic version of this grape. Drink now through 2004. 7,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Nice concentration, with vibrant lime, chive, gooseberry and mineral notes. Long, steely finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Tian Stellenbosch
review: Very minty, with soft plum and berry fruit as well. Toasty, minty finish. Mature, with nice texture, but for fans of the style. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Stellenbosch
review: Lots of mint and high-toned red fruit with some briar and cocoa notes too. Plush texture. Interesting, though likely too minty for most folks. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Akira Stellenbosch
review: Lots of mint and toast here, with modest blackberry fruit behind it. Smooth, but a bit one-dimensional. Cabernet Sauvignon and Pinotage. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Stellenbosch
review: Has a mix of menthol, plum and sweet toast with dusty tannins on the moderate finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Coastal Region
review: Beefy, plummy flavors, with a bacony, smoky finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: Very light, with slightly dilute lime flavor and a soft finish 650 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Neat and tight, with complex, well-focused flavors of earthy currant, cedary oak, plum and blackberry. Lively aftertaste. Drink now through 2007. 98 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Well focused, with pretty flavors of citrus and fig and elegant pineapple notes woven together with a light spiciness. Drink now. 1,297 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Smooth and creamy on the palate, with attractive pear, spice, apple and mineral flavors. On the finish however, it's a little bitter. 1,057 cases made.

name: Syrah Mendocino
review: A meaty, earthy wine--almost chewy in texture. Behind the tannins lie rich cassis and blackberry flavors. Has depth along with its slightly quirky personality. Drink now through 2001. 340 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Tightly wound, with a trim band of pear, citrus, herb and cedar notes. Turns light and simple. Drink now through 2004. 2,023 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi
review: Round and full-bodied, with dried berry flavors and earthy and oaky nuances. Drink now through 2004. 558 cases made.

name: Viño de la Tierra Ribera del Gállego Rosado Cinco Villas
review: This rosé has a chunky texture, with candied cherry and berry flavors that lean toward kirsch and vanilla. There's enough acidity to keep it lively. Garnacha and Tempranillo. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: A fruit bomb that's fresh, vivacious and flows across the palate like silk. Passion fruit and apricot flavors are accented by citrus, and the finish is mouthwatering. Drink now through 2002.

name: Riesling Kabinett Pfalz Kallstadter Saumagen
review: Forward and juicy, sporting light flavors of apricot, citrus and spice in a fleshy, round body. Drink now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Trocken Pfalz Kallstadter Steinacker
review: Dry and round in profile, offering a modicum of peach and spice notes. A bit dilute in the end. Drink now.

name: Sparkling Chardonnay Chalone Brosseau Vineyard
review: Crisp and quite minerally, with dusty, dry flavors and accents of lemon and spice. Drink now. 130 cases made.

name: Sparkling Chardonnay Mendocino County Alder Springs
review: Zesty if slightly heavy-handed, offering accents of apple and spice. Drink now. 85 cases made.

name: Idle Hands Red Mountain
review: Well-built and expressive, with floral wild berry and garrigue aromas and vibrant cherry, orange zest and dark chocolate flavors. Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2022. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Appealing for the pear and apricot flavors, accented by spicy cinnamon hints. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and refined, with an airy feel to the pretty plum and pear fruit that floats through the open-weave finish. Drink now. 80,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Bright and tangy, with juicy cranberry and raspberry flavors on the lively frame, lilting pleasantly on the finish. Drink now. 32,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light-footed, with pretty black cherry and floral flavors that pick up a mild buzz of tannins on the lingering finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and lively, featuring a floral, candied edge to the currant and plum fruit. Echoes nicely on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Red cherry and floral character persists nicely in the mouth in this fragrant red, picking up a hint of wet earth. Drink now through 2012. 1,700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and fresh, this offers delicate black cherry and floral flavors that echo nicely on the refined finish. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Underwood
review: Light and earthy, with a savory edge to the raspberry and spice flavors, lingering on the open texture. Drink now. 75,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Tart and trim, with modest candied rhubarb flavors. Drink now. 85,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Though very light and spicy, this is pretty, with berry flavors, and easy to drink. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley T.H.
review: This is filled with flavors of raspberry, plum preserves, blackberry and black olive. Fresh acidity provides backbone, while dark chocolate notes linger on the creamy finish. Drink now through 2021. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Leyda Valley Sibaris Gran Reserva
review: Features brick notes to the balanced and well-spiced flavors of dried berry, cola and pomegranate. Rich and minerally, with some creamy accents on the juicy finish. Drink now through 2019. 300 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserve Selection
review: Rich toast and coffee tones of new oak and ripe, concentrated plum and currant flavors provide depth. Good structure; lingering fruit finish. Drink now through 1997.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Sibaris Gran Reserva
review: A crisp style, with concentrated cherry, crushed red plum and currant flavors. Minerally midpalate, delivering a finish that offers plenty of white pepper and green herbal accents. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Leyda Valley T.H.
review: A well-sculpted red, with loads of savory notes to the ripe currant, cedar and pomegranate flavors. Hints of brick and clay show on the finish, presenting some smoky accents. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Bodega de Familia Maipo Valley
review: This sturdy red is balanced and fresh. Plum and coffee flavors gain weight from the muscular structure and carry through to the clean finish, with notes of herbs and cedar. A good match for rich dishes accented with herbs. Drink now through 2005. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley
review: Its pure fruit flavor shines through. Full of vibrant plum, cherry and berry flavors with smooth, polished texture. Medium-bodied, well balanced, clean and fresh, with mild tannins and a lingering finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Founder's Collection
review: Shows solid currant, mint and loam notes, on a firm, Old World-style palate, with slightly grainy tannins on the finish. The style will have some fans. Drink now through 2003. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Founder's Collection
review: Shows nice maturity, with elegant smoke, plum and black cherry. Sweet finish has a lingering cedar and vanilla mix. Pretty. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserva
review: Its bright fruit and good balance give it solid appeal; its herb and spice overtones and firm underlying tannins give it character. Well crafted. Drink now through 1998. 2,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserve Selection
review: Has plenty of flavor--and tannins. Marked by spicy, cedary aromas and concentrated cherry and berry flavors. Tempting to drink now, but should improve in the cellar. Drink now through 1995. 40,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Leyda Valley T.H.
review: Features lots of green pepper notes to the citrus and green apple flavors. Concentrated savory spice details linger on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Syrah Limarí Valley T.H.
review: A lively white pepper streak runs through this medium-weight Syrah, along with violet, crushed plum and blackberry fruit flavors. The finish is slightly taut. Drink now. 712 cases made.

name: Syrah Maipo Valley T.H.
