review: A toasty style, displaying cocoa and espresso notes that frame the medium-weight core of black cherry and plum fruit, turning to licorice on the finish. Drink now. 1,032 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserva
review: What's not to like? Very harmonious Cabernet. It's nicely balanced, well-rounded in texture, showing ample currant and cherry flavors and spicy oak accents. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley Reserva
review: Understated but quite attractive, this offers pear, vanilla and hazelnut flavors, balanced and fresh, with a fine, subtle finish. Try with light foods. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley T.H.
review: A bracing, lean style, offering tasty lime and mâche notes, with a crisp finish. Drink now. 222 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Leyda Valley T.H.
review: Very fresh and juicy, featuring kiwifruit, lime and grapefruit notes that are backed by a fresh, grass-tinged finish. Drink now. 722 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc San Antonio Valley Lo Abarca T.H.
review: Lively, with a nice citrus streak running through a mix of thyme, chive and salt notes. Drink now. 555 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserve Selection
review: A soft, supple, fruity Cabernet that's also showing the spicy, leathery aromas of maturity. Well-balanced and elegant in texture. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Colchagua Valley
review: A full-bodied marriage of ripe melon and toasty oak flavors, held together by firm acidity. Not complex, but balanced and bold. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Leyda Valley T.H.
review: Juicy and forward, offering cherry, pomegranate and floral notes backed by a lightly crisp finish. Drink now. 983 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lontué Valley
review: Pretty floral and mineral aromas are followed by clean, crisp flavors of grapefruit and herbs in this fresh, balanced wine. A well-focused match for lighter fish dishes. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Maipo Valley
review: A fresh, lively and crisp wine with pear and grapefruit aromas and flavors, accompanied by a whisper of herbs. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Colchagua Valley
review: Lively, with herb-accented berry and spice flavors and just enough tannin for grip. Nice minty notes linger on the finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley
review: This ripe, fleshy wine is thick with cassis, plum and chocolate flavors, full-bodied for Chile, with just enough tannin for grip. Can stand up to a steak. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Founder's Collection
review: Modest toast, plum and cherry fruit gives way to a rhubarb hint on the finish. Drink now. 5,300 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Sibaris Reserva Especial
review: Bright cherry and plum fruit is woven with mint and vanilla notes. Round, easy finish. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah Central Valley Aliwen Reserva
review: Taut, with medium-weight cherry, cocoa and vanilla notes. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Colchagua Valley
review: This lively mélange of apple, melon, toast and smoke flavors is more vibrant than harmonious, but crisp acidity keeps it refreshing and the flavors keep you coming back for more. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Casablanca Valley T.H.
review: Light and fresh, showing open-knit red and black cherry fruit woven with a whiff of mulled spice. Drink now. 685 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Curicó-Leyda Valleys Aliwen
review: A citrusy white, with a core of lemon and grapefruit notes followed by light spice and herb hints. Drink now. 43,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley
review: A generous, fruity red wine worth trying. It's smooth, plummy and rich tasting, with abundant soft tannins and a great, fruity finish. Drink now through 1993.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserve Selection
review: Earthy and gamy, with lots of rich, smoky cherry and mature Cabernet aromas and flavors, that smooth out, rounding nicely. A distinctive style that might take some getting used to, but it has its rewards. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère Central Valley Aliwen Reserva
review: Medium-weight, with soft, ripe cherry, plum and tobacco notes. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley
review: Vivid pineapple and citrus aromas give way to liveliness and tart acidity. It has a different profile than most South American Chards we've tasted, fresh and zingy. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley
review: Varietal character is evident in this round, fruity wine which offers bright berry flavors, light spice notes and a hint of herb. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Casablanca Valley T.H.
review: This tangy white leads with a hint of chive to the grapefruit, gooseberry and saline notes, which turn toward a lemony finish. Drink now. 548 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Central Valley Aliwen Reserva
review: Lean and crisp, with lime and herb notes. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserve Selection
review: Firm, chewy and flavorful, with a strong smoky, toasty component. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley
review: This firm white has good body and very crisp acidity, making it a solid accompaniment to food. Flavors are a bit austere, with citrus and light earthy notes. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley
review: Fresh, crisp, with a sappy edge to the bracing green apple flavor, pulsing nicely on the finish. Drink now.

name: Merlot Colchagua Valley
review: Soft, velvety texture is enticing, while the flavors lean toward the herbal side of Merlot, with cherry accents. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley
review: Fresh, straightforward and fruity, with good cherry and berry flavors. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserva
review: Has a little minty, earthy note, with some lightweight black cherry. A touch tart on the finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserve Selection
review: Rustic and mature, dominated by plum, smoke and cola flavors. A full-bodied wine, with modest tannins. Consume before the fruit totally disappears. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley
review: Shows some simple cherry and spice flavors, with a slightly stemmy note on the finish. Stays fresh enough. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Maipo Valley
review: Lean, very crisp and dominated by lemony acidity, with only light herb and apple flavors to flesh it out. A bit tart on its own, it should soften with food. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Maipo Valley
review: Honey and floral aromas and soft, peachy flavors taste more like Riesling than Sauvignon Blanc, but the wine is delicate and lively. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Maipo Valley
review: Crisp, light and lemony, a low-intensity wine with pleasant flavors and lively acidity. Drink now.

name: Carmenère Colchagua Valley Reserva
review: Has some rhubarb fruit to go with a charry note up front, then turns a little airy in the middle. Short finish. Drink now.

name: Merlot Colchagua Valley
review: Light-bodied berry, grapey flavors and soft, easy tannins. A quaffer. Drink now.

name: Merlot Maipo Valley
review: Lean and velvety, modest currant and herb flavors chiming in on the finish. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lontué Valley
review: Tart and tangy. This light-bodied white offers grapefruit and herbal flavors, very crisp and clean but rather simple. A refreshing aperitif. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Maipo Valley
review: Lively and straightforward, this simple white offers light citrus and pineapple flavors and a clean finish. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley
review: Light and slightly herbal, with beet and berry flavors in modest proportions.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley
review: Lime and green apple fruit, turning tart and lean in the end.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley Reserva
review: Flint, butter and apple flavors spar for the upper hand in this white, then fade before jangly acidity on the finish. 10,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Colchagua Valley
review: Shows more stewy, rhubarb notes than fresh fruit, with a slightly rustic finish. Light-bodied too.

name: Merlot Maipo Valley Reserva
review: This firm, traditional-styled Merlot has some red currant fruit, but dry-edged prune and cedar notes win out on the chewy finish. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley
review: Light and easy, with basic cherry fruit and an airy finish.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley
review: This light, soft red is no substitute for Burgundy, but it offers some attractive cherry and spicy flavors to go with its light herbal notes.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley Reserva
review: This Pinot has a mix of slightly stewy cherry, earth and cola notes, with moderate flesh and a rustic finish. Has weight, but lacks pure fruit. 3,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley Reserva
review: Medium-bodied, with some dark root beer and licorice notes, and a slightly rustic note on the finish.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lontué Valley
review: More like a Sémillon, with orange rind and spice notes, turning slightly coarse on the finish.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lontué Valley
review: Has some peach and grapefruit notes, but they fade a bit in the end.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Maipo Valley
review: A basic, unrefined Sauvignon Blanc, with plenty of grassy aromas, grapefruit flavors and crisp acidity. Nothing fancy, but solid in quality.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Colchagua Valley
review: This soft red offers straightforward cherry and herbal flavors, with light tannins and a short finish.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Reserva
review: This is airy, with stewed berry flavors and a dull, earthy finish. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Santa Ana
Chardonnay Maipo Valley
review: Thin, with modest grapefruit and grass flavors. Not particularly distinctive as a Chardonnay, but still a good, basic white wine.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley Reserva
review: Oaky flavors dominate this thick white. Apple and lemon notes are buried in the mix.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley
review: A generic red, this is soft and light, with some sweet cherry and light herbal flavors, an easy quaff that won't go the distance with a meal. Drink now; try slightly chilled.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Colchagua Valley
review: Muddled strawberry and earth notes mingle unceremoniously in this halfhearted red.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Colchagua Valley
review: Simple stuff, with monotone red cherry flavor that borders on dilute.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley
review: A sturdy red with predominant smoky-toasty notes.

name: Carmenère Colchagua Valley Reserva
review: Has a distinctly funky edge running through the firm currant and cedar flavors, with the finish turning rather stemmy and tough. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley
review: A light vegetal note detracts from this soft, thin white. It lacks fruit flavor and concentration.

name: Pinot Noir Maipo Valley
review: Light and airy, with a simple menthol and Bing cherry profile.

name: Merlot Maipo Valley
review: Tannic and full-bodied, with tomato, bell pepper and plumlike flavors. A big style, but hollow in the middle. Drink now, while it's still fresh.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley
review: Medium-bodied, with oniony aromas and appley flavors. Modest citrus and butter notes come out on the finish, but not enough to liven it up much.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Maipo Valley
review: Very ripe, oily and vegetal,with garlic and onion flavors to match the melon and pear.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley
review: A simple, straightforward red, with a bit of strawberry and tomato flavor and firm tannins. Palatable, but nothing special.

name: Chardonnay Maipo Valley Reserva
review: An unsettling deep color, with caramel and burnt butter notes and no fruit. Not much fun.

name: Merlot Maipo Valley Reserva
review: Has an odd peat-moss aroma and muddled flavors of cola and prunes. Then turns sour on the finish.

name: Alvarinho Vinho Verde Via Latina
review: Medium-bodied, with richness and clarity to the ripe apple flavors that are filled with creamy notes. An impressive version in the style of the New Wave Spanish Albariños. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas da Região dos Vinhos Verdes

name: Vinho Verde Pavão
review: Plenty of mineral, peach and ripe apple flavors in this Portuguese white, with citrusy notes on the fat finish. Drink now. 200,000 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas da Região dos Vinhos Verdes

name: Vinho Verde Rosé Pavão
review: Spritzy, showing ripe cherry flavors, with some meaty notes on the finish. 75,000 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas da Região dos Vinhos Verdes

name: Vinho Verde Via Latina
review: Canned fruit flavors and cheesy notes don't add up to much. 5,000 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas da Região dos Vinhos Verdes

name: Dão Adro da Sé Reserva
review: Mature aromas and flavors, yet still lively, with dried cherry, roasted meat and smoke flavors. Notes of sandalwood and Asian spice on the finish. Drink now. 5,560 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Touriga Nacional Dão
review: Pepper and smoke notes fill this nicely maturing red. Cherry and spice come in on the lively finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Beiras Irreverente
review: A juicy red, showing crunchy red plum and raspberry flavors, with peppery notes on the finish. Drink now. 5,550 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Dão White Dom Divino
review: A distinctive white, with apricot and baked apple flavors and mineral and stone notes. There's ripe pineapple on the finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Dão Dom Divino
review: Medium-bodied, with red plum and raspberry flavors followed by notes of currant and spice on the finish. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Dão
review: Has raspberry and sweet cherry flavors. The spicy finish features sandalwood and herb. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Dão Porta do Fontelo Red
review: Mature, tasting a bit stripped. Modest plum and dried cherry flavors. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Dão Porta do Fontelo White
review: Tinny tasting, with canned fruit flavors. 2,800 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Beiras White
review: A bit sour tasting, with a musty finish.  2,700 cases made.
winery: União das Adegas Cooperativas do Dão

name: Madeira 10 Year Old Colombo Reserve
review: Good richness and concentration from the aromas to the finish, all on an off-dry, elegant framework. Smoke and citrus peel flavors turn to a nutty, briny aftertaste that's refreshing and intriguing, leaving a bite at the end. Drink now.

name: Madeira Colombo Rainwater
review: Amber, with a rust tint, this is light-bodied and straightforward, showing caramel notes that turn to walnut on the aftertaste. A touch alcoholic on the finish. Drink now.

name: Fiano Riverland Jade & Jasper
review: Creamy and supple, with a butterscotch accent to the peach, pear and vanilla pudding notes. Spicy marmalade details linger effortlessly on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Dolcetto Clare Valley Cherry Fields
review: Soft and plummy, with dried violet and spice accents on an elegant, smooth frame. White pepper nuances show on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Bobal Viño de la Tierra de Castilla Rosado Señorío de Iniesta
review: This rosé has a striking scarlet color and assertive flavors of cherry, pomegranate and orange zest, backed by noticeable tannins. Has the structure to match with food. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Bobal Viño de la Tierra de Castilla Rosado Señorío de Iniesta
review: This rosé offers lush flavors of cherry and boysenberry, ripe and slightly jammy, in a thick texture with just enough acidity to keep it lively. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne Marcel Hemard Origine
review: Racy and taut, this Champagne delivers lemon, ginger and mineral aromas and flavors in a laserlike fashion. Just a tad astringent, with a chalky sensation on the finish. Drink now through 2015. 150 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Champagne Marcel Hemard Origine
review: A rich, opulent rosé, bursting with cherry, strawberry and floral flavors. It's fruity and forward, with more impact than elegance, yet very satisfying. Drink now. 520 cases made.

name: Rioja Manuel Quintano Reserva
review: Round and soft, this generous red delivers plum, blackberry, mocha and tobacco flavors. Rich yet well-defined. Supple, but there's enough structure for food. Drink now through 2012. 5,400 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Reserva
review: Toasty and smoky aromas give way to flavors of black cherry, espresso and licorice in this focused red. Light, firm tannins and lively acidity give structure to the supple, polished texture. Not big, but expressive. Drink now through 2016. 16,600 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Reserva
review: Fresh, firm and long. This balanced red offers crisp cherry, cola, vanilla, tobacco and fresh herb flavors, supported by well-integrated tannins that give way to a spicy, floral finish. Drink now through 2011. 15,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Crianza
review: This polished red delivers flavors of plum, currant, coffee and toast, supported by light, firm tannins and balsamic acidity. Harmonious, with some depth. Drink now through 2021. 40,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Crianza
review: Supple yet assertive, this smooth red delivers juicy black plum, fig, licorice and smoke notes over polished tannins, enlivened by bright acidity. This isn't weighty, but shows good density. Drink now through 2013. 66,666 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Reserva
review: Black cherry, dried herb and toasty flavors mingle in this firm red, with notes of black olive and tobacco. Features a polished texture and crisp acidity. Focused and spicy. Drink now through 2020. 16,600 cases made.

name: Rioja Manuel Quintano Reserva
review: This red shows well-integrated flavors of plum, mineral, smoke and cedar, with light, firm tannins and gentle acidity. Focused and harmonious. Drink now through 2016.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Crianza
review: Lithe and lively, this savory red offers currant, kirsch and dark chocolate flavors backed by tobacco and sous-bois notes. Features firm tannins and a balsamic finish. Drink now through 2013. 66,600 cases made.

name: Rioja Solagüen Crianza
review: Generous and deep, this large-production, full-bodied Spanish red still shows dark color and ripe fruit flavors, but also mature notes of spice, tobacco and cedar. It's balanced and firm, and should drink well through 2000. Hard to beat at this price. 416,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Crianza
review: This supple red offers black cherry and toast notes, with just enough tannins for grip. A bit herbaceous, but clean and fresh. Drink now through 2009. 67,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Solagüen Reserva
review: Harmonious, elegant and polished, showing black cherry, spice and smoke flavors. A bit lean but balanced. Still young, but drinking nicely now.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Reserva
review: This red is supple, showing dark flavors of raisin, licorice, smoke and earth, with light but firm tannins and a smoky, earthy finish. Assertive and a bit rustic, but shows personality. Drink now. 16,666 cases made.

name: Rioja Manuel Quintano Reserva
review: Tart cherry and licorice flavors are still bright and juicy in this lean red. Smoke and spice accents add interest. Needs food, but has focus. Drink now through 2009. 10,800 cases imported.

name: Rioja Manuel Quintano Reserva
review: This ripe red offers plenty of coffee and toasty flavors from oak, with a core of ripe fruit backed by polished tannins. An austere wine made in the modern style. Drink now through 2004.

name: Rioja Solagüen Reserva
review: Smooth in texture and complex in aroma, but the modest raisin and cherry flavors are dropping out already. Has a certain faded elegance, but we would have preferred more vitality. Drink now.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida
review: Leafy and herbal flavors mingle over notes of chocolate and plum in this soft red, with a plump texture, light tannins and fine acidity. Drink now. 41,700 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Crianza
review: Herbal and leafy flavors frame cherry and berry fruit in this focused red. A plush texture is enlivened by bright, citrusy acidity. A touch candied, but vivid. Drink now through 2015. 41,600 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Crianza
review: This focused red delivers tart cherry, light vanilla and spice flavors on a lean, crisp frame. Lively, with just enough structure for food. Drink now through 2009. 50,000 cases imported.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Madurado
review: Smoky and leafy notes mingle with cherry and herbal flavors in this lean, fresh red. Possesses a supple texture, with crisp acidity and just enough tannins for grip. Drink now through 2014. 41,600 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Reserva
review: This red offers coffee, tobacco and cherry flavors on a solid frame, with a spicy, licorice finish. A bit austere, but has the structure for food. Drink now. 125,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Reserva
review: Smoky, herbal and gamy notes accent a core of cherry fruit in this chunky red. Still fresh, it has the backbone to match with food. Drink now through 2007. 8,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Solagüen Gran Reserva
review: This chewy red offers raisin, coffee and light earth flavors. Thick on the palate, with firm, slightly dry tannins. Spice notes emerge on the finish, but the structure is outlasting the fruit. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Crianza
review: This supple red shows traditional flavors of cherries, spice and fresh tobacco leaf; light but fresh. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Montebuena
review: Firm, with black cherry, smoke and lightly gamy flavors and moderate tannins that turn a bit dry on the finish. Balanced and fresh. Drink now through 1999. 35,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Solagüen Crianza
review: Shows good structure, with a nice balance of firm tannins, crisp acidity and a refreshing texture. The flavors are a bit dull, though, with earthy, gamy notes and not much fruit. Try with food, or give it until 1998 to bloom. 36,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida
review: This supple red offers bright berry and cherry flavors, with notes of spice and orange peel. Features juicy acidity and light tannins. Drink now. 41,600 cases made.

name: Rioja Castillo Labastida Reserva
review: A spicy, balsamic note underlines coffee, plum and earth flavors in this maturing red. Licorice and sanguine notes linger on the finish. Drink now. 16,600 cases made.

name: Rioja White Montebuena
review: Vanilla and lanolin flavors add nuance to this dry, clean and fresh white, but there isn't much fruit for balance. 30,000 cases made.

name: Corse Rosé Domaine Santa Giulietta
review: Very fresh, with cherry pit, peach and rose water notes, backed by a light mineral twinge on the finish. Niellucciu and Grenache. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

name: Vin de Corse Rosé Terra Corsa
review: Light but lively, with cherry pit and watermelon rind notes that zip through, staying focused on the dry, stony finish. Niellucciu and Grenache. Drink now. 24,000 cases made.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

name: Vin de Corse Rosé Terra Corsa
review: Fresh and racy, with an iron hint running through the cherry pit and white peach flavors. The pure, refreshing finish is tightly focused. Nielluccio and Grenache. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

name: Sciaccarellu Île de Beauté Rosé Marestagno
review: Fresh and direct, with light orange zest, peach and white cherry notes framed by a savory hint. Shows good cut through the finish. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.
winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

name: Rioja White Viña Otano
review: This muscular white shows traditional style, offering flavors of pear, quince, lanolin, tea and blanched almond, with savory elements framing a core of fresh and dried fruit notes. Lively acidity freshens the thick texture and keeps the spicy finish fresh and clean. Drink now through 2024. 350 cases made.

name: Rioja Marqués de Tomares Gran Reserva
review: Evolving nicely, this full-bodied red still has a core of ripe plum fruit, but mature flavors of tobacco, coffee and mineral add complexity and length. Not exuberant, but solid, and still has life ahead. Drink now through 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Viña Otano Crianza
review: Bright cherry and red plum flavors are juicy and lively in this fresh red. Citrusy acidity, leafy notes and a spicy finish add complexity. Light, with moderate tannins and good balance. Drink now through 2020. 25,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Viña Otano Reserva
review: Savory notes of licorice, coffee and mineral shadow modest plum fruit in this sanguine red, with a polished texture supported by firm tannins. Old-school and well-balanced. Drink now through 2019. 6,250 cases made.

name: Rioja Don Román
review: A soft, fleshy texture carries roasted plum, coffee and spicy flavors in this ripe red. A bit top-heavy, but has enough tannin and acidity for grip. Spicy finish. Drink now through 2009. 8,520 cases made.

name: Rioja Marqués de Tomares Crianza
review: This firm red shows good ripeness and structure, with black cherry, raisin and kirsch flavors, framed by strong coffee and light earthy flavors that dominate the finish. Drink now through 2007. 10,416 cases made.

name: Rioja Don Román
review: Charry aromas and flavors detract from the cherry fruit, and the tannins are lean and a bit dry. It has structure, but needs food for balance. Drink now through 2008. 4,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Marqués de Tomares Crianza
review: Plum, raisin, tobacco and toast flavors mingle in this red. These dark notes are alluring, despite the rather lean texture. Needs food to soften. Drink now through 2006. 6,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Viña Otano Crianza
review: A broad, supple texture carries licorice, tobacco and tea flavors in this savory red. Black cherry and smoke notes are a bit diffused, while the tannins turn grippy on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 25,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Viña Otano Gran Reserva
review: The cherry, coffee and earthy flavors are a bit muddled in this thick red, with gritty tannins and tart acidity. Shows some concentration, but remains rustic. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Viura Rioja Viña Otano
review: A polished texture carries modest flavors of pear and apple peel, with light herbal notes, backed by firm acidity. Reserved but balanced. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Rioja Don Román
review: This chewy red shows coffee and toast notes from oak, framing ripe plum and light earth flavors. A bit rustic, but has concentration. Drink now through 2005. 3,860 cases made.

name: Rioja Marqués de Tomares Gran Reserva
review: This plump red shows ripe flavors of plums and prunes, but it's a bit soft and stewed in character, with mushroom notes mingling with the spices. Drink now. 570 cases made.

name: Rioja Viña Otano Gran Reserva
review: This maturing red offers stewed plum, coffee and loam flavors, with a round texture supported by slightly drying tannins and balsamic acidity. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc New Jersey Windfall
review: Apple, vanilla and spice notes are attractive, if somewhat blunt, in this full-bodied white. A touch of oak adds dimension to the flavors. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Seyval Blanc New Jersey Windfall
review: Aggressive toasty, smoky oak flavors overwhelm the fruit in this thick, chewy wine. Though a bit startling at first sip, it grows on you, finishing with pretty pineapple notes. Unbalanced but appealing. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Hunter's White Reserve New Jersey
review: A big-boned, aggressively dry wine with some attractive citrus, floral and smoky notes. It's clean and bold. Vidal Blanc. Drink now. 425 cases made.

name: Chambourcin New Jersey
review: A hint of dough on the nose, with some grape flavor and a tart cherry note on the finish. 320 cases made.

name: Hunter's White Reserve New Jersey
review: Light grapefruit rind flavor, with a quick, tart finish. Vidal Blanc. 270 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon New Jersey
review: Hollow, with faint dried mushroom and cherry pit notes. 398 cases made.

name: Chardonnay New Jersey
review: Gold color. Hint of baked apple. Vapid finish. 229 cases made.

name: Hunter's Red Meritage Reserve New Jersey
review: Limp, dried-out and stemmy. 427 cases made.

name: Hawkes Bay
review: Crisp, juicy and lively, with black cherry and blackberry flavors that linger brightly on the polished finish. Best from 2003 through 2006. 2,200 cases made.

name: Syrah Hawkes Bay Gimblett Gravels
review: The fresh plum, blackberry and licorice-tinged huckleberry flavors are accented by mineral, spice and peppery details. The tannins gain traction on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 197 cases made.

name: Hawkes Bay
review: Lean and smooth, with a strong minty-herbal component coursing through the berry and chocolate flavors. A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2003. 2,000 cases made.

name: Selection Hawkes Bay
review: Bright and crisp, with pretty blueberry and currant flavors, and firm tannins that will need time to soften. Best from 2004 through 2006. 2,000 cases made.

name: Selection Hawkes Bay
review: Light in structure, chewy with tannins, with modest currant flavors trying to peek through. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best after 2004. 2,500 cases made.

name: Hawkes Bay
review: A bit thin on texture, with vegetal flavors and modest fruit. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Despite ripe, jammy, peppery aromas, it's rather light and elegant on the palate, with a touch of earthiness and soft tannins. Like many '88s it lacks concentration, so it should drink well in the next few years. Drink now.

name: St.-Emilion Grand Theatre
review: Features a tarry frame, with steeped plum and cherry fruit at the core. Tar and alder hints grace the finish. Drink now through 2014. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Bordeaux Grand Theatre
review: Offers thyme, kaffir lime and kiwifruit notes, with a bright, crackling finish. Drink now. 28,500 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Axel des Vignes
review: Lightly firm, with pomegranate and black cherry fruit backed by a modest herb note. Drink now. 84,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Mayne Sansac
review: Lightly firm, with grilled herb, plum skin and cherry pit notes that stay fresh on the modest finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux White Axel des Vignes
review: Shows crisp chive, thyme and lime pulp notes, with a fresh, crunchy finish. Refreshing. Drink now. 26,550 cases made.

name: Bordeaux White Axel des Vignes
review: Shows fresh citrus peel, straw and white peach flavors, with a gentle finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Bordeaux Belair-Moustet
review: Features a lightly salty edge, with white asparagus, lemon zest and white peach flavors zipping along. Reveals a herbal twinge through the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Grand Theatre
review: Pomegranate, cherry and tomato notes mesh here, with a light tobacco thread on the finish. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Rosé Axel des Vignes
review: A soft, easy style, with strawberry and tea notes backed by a light cranberry accent on the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux White Axel des Vignes
review: Good citrus and sweet pea notes end with a lively finish. Clean and refreshing. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Axel des Vignes
review: Straightforward, with bitter cherry, light toasty cedar and plum skin notes. Drink now. 55,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Grand Theatre
review: Open, with an airy core of plum and mulled cherry fruit, flecked with sanguine and tobacco hints on the finish. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Roc St.-André
review: Quick, with light plum and cherry pit notes. A hint of chalk marks the finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Rosé Axel des Vignes
review: Plump and soft, with forward strawberry and cherry fruit lined with a savory edge. Fresh, but may be a touch too vegetal for some folks. Drink now. 10,500 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Rosé Axel des Vignes
review: Soft cherry and strawberry notes are backed by a light herb hint on the finish. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Bordeaux Grand Theatre
review: Quick and light, with direct herb and lime notes. Drink now. 35,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Axel des Vignes
review: A bit brisk for a red, with taut damson plum, cherry pit and dried orange peel notes backed by a sinewy feel on the finish. Drink now. 65,000 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Roc St.-André
review: Savory herb, cherry and toast notes mingle in this light-bodied red. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Bordeaux Roc des Moulins
review: Light, with muddled plum and rhubarb fruit, laced with a hint of grilled herb. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Aromatic, offering a mix of honeysuckle, peach blossom and lemongrass notes, with a smooth, fleshy body of apricot and white peach details, accented by a mineral edge and a honey hint on the finish. A crisp, refreshing acidity punctuates the flavors. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: The lush melon and nectarine flavors show a squirt of lemon, with echoes of chamomile in the background. Drink now. 5,200 cases made.

name: Cuvée Foudre Dry Creek Valley
review: A classy cuvée that's firm, intense, full-bodied and concentrated, with a zesty mix of wild berry and huckleberry jam notes joined by spicy, peppery scents. Ends with excellent acidity, structure and tight tannins. Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2013. 260 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Precise and lively, with a zesty, briary edge, offering aromas of dusty rose and flavors of raspberry, dark cherry, grilled anise and white pepper. Drink now through 2024. 1,100 cases made.

name: Grenache Dry Creek Valley
review: A well-built red that's ripe and structured, with floral raspberry aromas and zesty flavors of black cherry, smoky pepper and anise. The tannins firm up the finish slightly. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Rosé Dry Creek Valley
review: Sleek and lively, with floral raspberry aromas and crisp flavors of strawberry and smoky spice. Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Juicy and zesty, with appealing raspberry and toasty sage aromas and supple, delicately complex cherry, anise and spice flavors that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 1,250 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Black raspberry and cracked pepper aromas open to focused cherry, licorice and orange zest flavors. Drink now through 2023. 750 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Shows bright, jammy black cherry, raspberry and spice aromas, with fresh, supple flavors that roll to a zesty finish. Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Dry Creek Valley
review: Tart and focused, with appealing notes of smoked cranberry and spicy grilled herbs. Drink now through 2020. 575 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley
review: Lean, with spicy, beefy, leathery berry and cherry, turning firm, with crisp mineral and sage notes. Drink now through 2006. 1,673 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Briary and a touch rustic, with notes of wild berry, underbrush and pepper. Drink now through 2020. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,050 cases made.

name: Syrah Dry Creek Valley
review: Beefy and herbal, with chunky black cherry and spice. Firm tannins and acid structure. Give it a year to soften. Best from 2002 through 2006. 1,325 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Dense and briary, with rustic black cherry, sage and cracked pepper flavors. Best from 2013 through 2017. 1,275 cases made.

name: Rosé Dry Creek Valley
review: Crisp and easy to drink, with floral strawberry aromas and dry and ultraspicy and smoky raspberry flavors. Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 950 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Dry Creek Valley
review: Dried currant, plum, leather and bay leaf flavors have good depth and lively tannic structure. Drink now through 2004. 799 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley
review: Ripe plum, licorice and cracked pepper aromas lead to stewed raspberry and roasted anise flavors and minerally tannins. Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. Drink now. 1,345 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Red Mountain
review: Broad and expressive, with an earthy cast to the black cherry and tea leaf flavors, finishing with a hint of grapefruit peel. Best after 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Yakima Valley Old Vine
review: Sleek, focused and distinctive for the way it plays its pure currant and plum fruit against lively acidity and a floral note. Brings it all together with fine tannins for a long, satisfying finish. Best from 2010 through 2016. 99 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Rogue Valley
review: Fresh and vibrant, with dense red pepper-accented cherry and black pepper flavors, lingering against lightly gritty tannins on the generous finish. Drink now through 2017. 100 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Rogue Valley
review: Firm in texture, with a minty note weaving through the ripe black cherry and sassafras flavors, lingering on a moderate frame. Drink now through 2019. 260 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Rogue Valley
review: Firm in texture, a layer of chewy tannin wrapping the ripe, smoky black fruit and licorice flavors. Finishes with nice intensity. Best after 2016. 155 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Rogue Valley
review: Crisp, dark and distinctive, with bay leaf, rosemary and smoky pepper flavors. A blackberry character rises up on the taut finish. Best after 2015. 110 cases made.

name: Oso Grande Rogue Valley
review: Firm and modestly built, with notes of dried cherry and smoky herb, finishing with gritty tannins. Grenache, Syrah and Tempranillo. Best after 2017. 120 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rogue Valley
review: Tangy, earthy style seeds waxy, smoky character through the pear and lemon flavors. Drink now. 190 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc North Coast
review: Floral details of honeysuckle and lemongrass add an air of elegance to the crisp lemon, lime and apple notes. Drink now. 31,646 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tense and vibrant, tightly coiled and laced with dusty, gravelly earth and cedary oak notes, this has a solid core of currant and blackberry flavors, imparting a presence of dusty earth and wood, with a dried herb edge. Drink now. 375 cases made.

name: Grenache Blanc Santa Ynez Valley
review: Spicy, with plenty of grapefruit peel and green apple notes that lend an appealing bitter, crisp edge to the citrus flavors. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Light and refreshing, offering lemongrass, lime, melon, grapefruit and green apple notes, finishing crisp, with a touch of grapefruit pith. Drink now. 275 cases made.

name: Free Rein Central Coast
review: Lip-smacking and juicy, with a blend of pear, peach and melon flavors, accented by lemon zest, floral and spice details. Shows plenty of fresh-grated ginger hints on the finish. Chardonnay and Pinot Gris. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Rosé Thrill California
review: A fun quaff, with soft flavors of strawberry and spice. Drink now. 175 cases made.

name: Remedy Central Coast
review: A fun quaff, with zippy flavors of black cherry, caramel and spice. Grenache, Syrah and Counoise. Drink now through 2019. 225 cases made.

name: Cuvée Lola Shenandoah Valley
review: Ripe, easy-drinking and a bit racy, with floral wild berry, anise, cedar and touches of spice. Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Petite Sirah. Drink now. 164 cases made.

name: Dolcetto El Dorado County
review: A zesty red, with notes of ripe cranberry, roasted rosemary and pepper. Finishes with chewy tannins. Drink now through 2016. 120 cases made.

name: Barbera Amador County
review: Offers notes of cherry pie and spicy vanilla. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero
review: A unique smokey, toasty aroma and rich tobacco, herb and plum flavors mark this full-bodied, tannic red as something out of the ordinary. The dense but fine tannins and the lingering fruit flavors would indicate further improvement if aged. Drink now through 1995.

name: Ribera del Duero
review: Light, smooth and flavorful, with generous black cherry and blackberry aromas and flavors. Echoes fruit on the soft, velvety finish. Drinkable now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero
review: Young, rough and jammy tasting, with plenty of fresh fruit and firm tannins. Not elegant, but good and hearty.

name: Greco di Tufo
review: Very attractive aromas of ripe apples and piecrust. Medium body, with good acidity and a medium finish. Delicious. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Falanghina Beneventano
review: Slightly dull but some decent lemon and green apple peel character. Medium body. Fresh finish. Drink now. 1,650 cases made.

name: Fiano di Avellino
review: Apple and licorice on the nose. Medium-bodied, with a slightly plastic aftertaste. Not nice. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir New Zealand Gladstone
review: Plum and black cherry flavors have a spicy, clove-infused side, with a touch of tomato leaf and notes of cigar box and tobacco on the sleek finish. Drink now through 2027. 7,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Wairarapa
review: This shows a distinctive licorice note up front, with crisp, pure cherry and pomegranate flavors at the core and a whiff of clove and white pepper on the finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Wairarapa
review: Crisp raspberry and pomegranate notes are defined by the firm but smooth texture, with spice, tobacco, black tea and cigar box nuances. Drink now through 2023. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Wairarapa
review: Loamy overtones and a fresh wet clay note give way to rich raspberry and black cherry flavors. This features plenty of tobacco and spice details, and a plush texture. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Wairarapa
review: Lime and grapefruit flavors have a fresh, grassy side, with bright, vibrant acidity. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Wairarapa
review: This is earthy, peppery in style, with lean dried cherry and plum flavors, a hint of licorice and fine-grained tannins. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah California Vineyard Blend
review: A wall of drying tannins shroud the cranberry and pomegranate flavors within. Has spice accents and cedary highlights on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah El Dorado Duarte Georgetown Vineyard
review: A very tannic and drying style, with hints of berries and cola. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Paso Robles Shell Creek Vineyard
review: Drying tannins overshadow the herb, cola, date and prune notes. 400 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Zesty and peppery, with black fruit, cassis and plum flavors framed by toasty oak and sage notes. The tannins are solid and tough, with a dry finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Malbec, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2012. 775 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Coconut macaroon flavors dominate a mix of currant, rhubarb and cedar; nothing about it says Napa Valley and it's pleasant to drink, but expensive. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. 500 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Peppery, sage-infused leather notes have a charry oak and black cherry profile. A rustic style, with chewy tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 1,450 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Stellenbosch Single Vineyard
review: A ripe, bold style, with lots of fig and pear fruit laced with alluring hazelnut, almond and warm brioche notes. Yet stays pure and driven on the finish, with a lingering hint of honeysuckle. There's also some power in reserve for modest cellaring. Drink now through 2011. 400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Stellenbosch
review: A focused style, with racy lemon verbena, gooseberry and straw notes that extend through the tangy finish. Very solid. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Stellenbosch
review: An upright version, with rather solid structure supporting the black currant, roasted plum and fig fruit, followed by a tarry edge on the finish. This has good posture, if a bit stiff in the end. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2011. 750 cases made.

name: Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon Stellenbosch Cellar Selection
review: Mature, offering dark currant and fig notes that give way to hints of coffee and toasted brown bread. Has a slight rustic twinge on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Oakville
review: Pleasant, with black cherry and vanilla aromas and understated, slightly austere flavors of cherry, cola and fennel. Drink now through 2006. 1,040 cases made.

name: Zelo Bianco Napa Valley Carneros
review: Vividly floral, with peach blossom, rose petal and spicy accents to the core of melon and citrus flavors. Smooth, round and complex, this finishes juicy and with a touch of honeysuckle. Pinot Grigio, Traminer and Muscat. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Zinfandel El Dorado Radix Vinea
review: Rustic and a touch sweet, with baked cherry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2020. 430 cases made.

name: Primitivo Lodi
review: Lean and tangy, with simple notes of smoky herb and dried cherry. Drink now. 479 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Manjar de Silos
review: This foursquare red shows density and balance, with cherry, kirsch, vanilla, cedar and tobacco flavors that balance nicely with the polished tannins. The gamy and mineral notes add character. Austere but true. Drink now through 2014. 6,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Palomero
review: Crisp, juicy flavors have nice density in this polished red. Cherry, berry, floral, herbal and vanilla notes mingle over smooth tannins, while racy acidity drives the floral and spicy finish. Drink now through 2018. 10,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Palomero Vendimia Seleccionada
review: This plush red adds alluring floral and vanilla notes to the black cherry, licorice and mineral flavors characteristic of the region. It has enough grip and acidity to match with food. Drink now through 2010. 200 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Palomero
review: Stiff tannins support and rather dominate the black cherry, tobacco and spice flavors in this traditional red. Plenty of concentration, but needs food to soften. Best from 2007 through 2015. 1,990 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Palomero
review: Nicely poised between youth and maturity, this red shows black cherry, tobacco and licorice flavors over tannins that are beginning to soften. Not showy, but balanced for food. Drink now through 2010. 1,675 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Palomero
review: Toasty and vanilla oak flavors support black cherry and light gamy flavors in this firm red. It's clean and modern. A bit oaky, but crisp acidity keeps it lively. Drink now through 2008. 2,415 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Palomero Nueva Era Crianza
review: Smooth in texture, this maturing red shows dried cherry, tobacco, cedar and cola flavors, with light, supple tannins and gentle acidity. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Septiembre
review: This light red offers light berry, cherry and herbal flavors, with brisk acidity and supple tannins. A spicy, slightly gamy note lingers. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Torrontés Cafayate Camino del Inca
review: Ripe layers of tangerine, clementine and peach are focused and cut, with hints of fleur de sel on the creamy yet vibrant finish. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Camino del Inca Quipu Blend Cafayate
review: Brooding, with mulled currant, fig and coffee notes backed by prune and bittersweet cocoa notes. More grip than depth in the end. Tannat, Malbec and Syrah. Drink now. 112 cases imported.

name: Malbec Cafayate Camino del Inca
review: Both samples provided were corky. 1,120 cases made.

name: Morges Vieilles Vignes
review: Fresh and crisp, with the hallmark blanched-almond, smoke and olive flavors of Swiss whites. Light- to medium-bodied, with some ripe fruit character. Drink now. 2,080 cases made.

name: Nyon Vieilles Vignes
review: Focused and fresh, with appealing floral, mineral and apple flavors. Not concentrated, but still lively. Delicate and makes a nice apéritif. 100 percent Chasselas. 5,415 cases made.

name: La Côte Les Rocards
review: This soft red offers a core of ripe berry flavors with notes of chocolate and toast. There's not much structure, but lightly chilled it makes a pleasant aperitif. 2,080 cases made.

name: Morges Vieilles Vignes
review: This is rich and too heavy-handed. Good honeyed, smoky marzipan flavors, but low in acidity and short on fruit. 100 percent Chasselas. 5,830 cases made.

name: Nyon Vieilles Vignes
review: Very soft, but also nutty, buttery, peachy and flowery. Ripe, medium-bodied, flabby on the finish. 2,080 cases made.

name: Vin Santo Napa Valley
review: A wonderful Vin Santo, vibrating with almond, pear, floral and citrus peel flavors, sweet but not unctuous, rich but not heavy. 150 cases made.

name: Vin Santo Napa Valley
review: Amber in color, with woody aromas, but the flavors run toward caramel, almond and nutmeg, hitting a peppery note on the finish. Ready now. 400 cases made.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Eisenberg Szapary
review: Very stylish and rich, with well-sculpted flavors of raspberry, plum pudding and spice. Pure, minerally and juicy, with pepper, mint and chocolate on the fresh finish.  Drink now through 2014. 50 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Südburgenland Eisenberg
review: A medium-bodied, elegant red, featuring fresh, juicy flavors of cherry, plum and berry. The spicy finish is crisp and creamy. Drink now through 2013. 75 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Eisenberg
review: A stylish red, with plenty of freshness to the red fruit flavors, which are flanked by a zesty spiciness and mocha java notes. The lively finish features cream and smoke. Drink now through 2014. 100 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Eisenberg
review: This has a spicy, beefy aroma and crisp, firm flavors of wild plum and raspberry, with medium-grained tannins on the minerally finish. Drink now through 2013. 75 cases imported.

name: Blaufränkisch Qualitätswein Trocken Südburgenland Königsberg
review: Rich, meaty aromas and flavors are joined by notes of dried berry and plum. Mineral finish features peppery notes. Drink now through 2011. 75 cases imported.

name: Tafelwein Trocken Südburgenland Vörösbor Vaszkeresztes Vashegy Pala
review: This red shows firm red plum, red currant and cherry flavors that feature interesting notes of spiced melon. Hints of anise and cream mark the finish. Blaufränkisch. Drink now through 2013. 25 cases imported.

name: Tafelwein Trocken Südburgenland Vörösbor Vaszkeresztes Vashegy Pala
review: Medium-bodied,with menthol and herbal overtones to the red plum flavors. Tannic finish. Drink now. 50 cases imported.
